definition: Built systems and structures that support transportation, utilities, and public movement through an area.

positive_examples: The city invested millions in repairing bridges and expanding the subway system.
Traffic was diverted while crews repaired the damaged section of highway.
The ancient Roman aqueducts demonstrate remarkable engineering prowess.
Construction of the new tunnel will reduce commute times significantly.
Pedestrians use the sidewalk to walk safely alongside busy roads.
The railway connects remote mountain villages to the main city.
negative_examples: The library was built in the classical architectural style.
Tourists visited the historic lighthouse on the rocky coast.
The factory produces steel components for various industries.
Archaeologists discovered ancient pottery buried in the ruins.
The hospital emergency room was crowded with patients.
Students gathered in the university's main auditorium.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Building, Monument, Facility, Structure
